short_description: This function divides input graph in communities.
long_description: The function establishes communities among vertices based on the edges (similarity) in a graph by maximizing modularity metric.

argument_clauses.name: Domain
argument_clauses.description: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queenâ€™s IP saddress or hostname.

argument_clauses.name: Database
argument_clauses.description: The name of the database where the input table is located.

argument_clauses.name: UserId
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.

argument_clauses.name: Password
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database password of the user.

argument_clauses.name: SSLSettings
argument_clauses.description: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.

argument_clauses.name: SSLTrustStorePassword
argument_clauses.description: The password for the SSL truststore.

argument_clauses.name: CommunityAssociation
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the column that represents the community association of the vertices.

argument_clauses.name: Resolution
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the hierarchical (zoom-in) level information for the communities. Each input value must be no less than 0.0 and no greater than 1000000.0. The default value is 1.0.

argument_clauses.name: CommunityEdgeTable
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name for the table that the function generates to contain the weights of the edges between the communities at different resolution levels.

argument_clauses.name: Seed
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the seed to use for creating a random number during modularity computation. The input value must be no less than 1. The default value is 1.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns from vertices that are to be passed to the output.

argument_clauses.name: TargetKey
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns that comprise the target vertex key in edges table.

argument_clauses.name: EdgeWeight
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the column in the edges table that contains the edge weights for a weighted graph. Input columns can be the following SQL types: [integer, smallint, bigint, double precision, numeric, real].

argument_clauses.name: Directed
argument_clauses.description: The argument indicated whether the edges are directed or not. The default value is true.
